title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: When invoking the New Java Package wizard, a confusing message appears at the top: 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists', even when the package name field is empty. It is unclear what exactly this message means and whether it is an error. The finish button should be disabled when the package name field is empty. It is also noted that a default package cannot be created by the user as it always exists.
OB: When invoking the New Java Package wizard, the following message appears at the top: 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists', even when the package name field is empty.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a new Java Project. 
2. Select the project. 
3. Invoke the New Java Package wizard. 
4. Observe the message behavior and ensure the package name field is empty.
